ent.origin: Middle English (as a verb): from the Germanic base of Old English wagian 'to sway'.

p.def: (especially with reference to an animal's tail) move or cause to move rapidly to and fro.
A single rapid movement from side to side:
p.eg: A chirpy wag of the head.

ent.rhy: bag, blag, brag, Bragg, crag, dag, drag, flag, gag, hag, jag, lag, mag, nag, quag, rag, sag, scrag, slag, snag, sprag, stag, swag, tag, zag
